channel.title: Buying a Monitor
channel.description:
Hey, so I need your advice since this is an area I don't have much experience in.
I'm trying to decide between four monitors on Best Buy (yes, it has to be on best buy, and these four are my only options as they're the only ones available in my store), but I'm stuck because I can't tell if a 100,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio is really much better than a 50,000:1 contrast ratio, etc. etc.
My four choices: [url=https://www.bestbuy.com/site/AOC+-+22%22+Widescreen+Flat-Panel+LCD+HD+Monitor+-+Black/9635684.p?id=1218135449679&skuId=9635684]AOC 2236VW[/url] [url=https://www.bestbuy.com/site/LG+-+21.5%22+Widescreen+Flat-Panel+TFT-LCD+Monitor+-+Glossy+Black/9750945.p?id=1218167168775&skuId=9750945]LG W2240T[/url] [url=https://www.bestbuy.com/site/Dell+-+22%22+Widescreen+Flat-Panel+LCD+Monitor/9769352.p?id=1218170032082&skuId=9769352]Dell STB2210[/url] [url=https://www.bestbuy.com/site/AOC+-+24%22+Widescreen+Flat-Panel+TFT-LCD+Monitor+-+Black/1180422.p?id=1218231018207&skuId=1180422]AOC 2436Vh[/url]
I'm leaning towards either the Dell or LG, since they're both the same cost and I don't trust AOC very much, especially after reading some of the reviews, but I thought I'd put them in here anyway to see if some of you would recommend them.
Some specs on the monitors in case you don't feel like clicking the links above: [u]AOC 2236VW, 22"[/u] 5 ms response time; 60,000:1 contrast ratio; 300 cd/m² brightness; 1920 x 1080 resolution; 170° horizontal and 160° vertical viewing angles; DVI-D with HDCP and RGB D-sub input [u]LG W2240T, 21.5"[/u] 5 ms response time; 70,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio; 300 cd/m² brightness; 1920 x 1080 maximum resolution; 170° horizontal and 160° vertical viewing angles; D-sub and DVI-D inputs [u]Dell STB2210, 22"[/u] 5 ms response time; 50,000:1 contrast ratio; 250 cd/m² brightness; 1920 x 1080 resolution; 160° horizontal and vertical viewing angles; DVI with HDCP, HDMI and VGA inputs [u]AOC 2436Vh, 24"[/u] 5 ms response time; 100,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio; 200 cd/m² brightness; 1920 x 1080 resolution; 170° horizontal and 160° vertical viewing angles; HDMI input; built-in speakers
A few more details: I'm going to be doing a lot of gaming and HD movie watching, and I'll probably be using the DVI connector. Will be using it with [url=https://www.bestbuy.com/site/Dell+-+Studio+XPS+Desktop+/+Intel%26%23174%3B+Core%26%23153%3B+i7+Processor+/+8GB+Memory+/+1.5TB+Hard+Drive/1244502.p?id=1218240957609&skuId=1244502]this computer[/url], most likely
Thanks in advance for the help!
EDIT: maybe i shouldve put this in help and support, my bad

item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
Hey, so I need your advice since this is an area I don’t have much experience in.

I’m trying to decide between four monitors on Best Buy (yes, it has to be on best buy, and these four are my only options as they’re the only ones available in my store), but I’m stuck because I can’t tell if a 100,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio is really much better than a 50,000:1 contrast ratio, etc. etc.

My four choices:
AOC 2236VW
LG W2240T
Dell STB2210
AOC 2436Vh

I’m leaning towards either the Dell or LG, since they’re both the same cost and I don’t trust AOC very much, especially after reading some of the reviews, but I thought I’d put them in here anyway to see if some of you would recommend them.

Some specs on the monitors in case you don’t feel like clicking the links above:
AOC 2236VW, 22"
5 ms response time; 60,000:1 contrast ratio; 300 cd/m² brightness; 1920 x 1080 resolution; 170° horizontal and 160° vertical viewing angles; DVI-D with HDCP and RGB D-sub input
LG W2240T, 21.5"
5 ms response time; 70,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio; 300 cd/m² brightness; 1920 x 1080 maximum resolution; 170° horizontal and 160° vertical viewing angles; D-sub and DVI-D inputs
Dell STB2210, 22"
5 ms response time; 50,000:1 contrast ratio; 250 cd/m² brightness; 1920 x 1080 resolution; 160° horizontal and vertical viewing angles; DVI with HDCP, HDMI and VGA inputs
AOC 2436Vh, 24"
5 ms response time; 100,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio; 200 cd/m² brightness; 1920 x 1080 resolution; 170° horizontal and 160° vertical viewing angles; HDMI input; built-in speakers

A few more details:
I’m going to be doing a lot of gaming and HD movie watching, and I’ll probably be using the DVI connector. Will be using it with this computer, most likely

Thanks in advance for the help!
